NationMania.ui

Class GameFonts

  • java.lang.Object
    • NationMania.ui.GameFonts

  • public final class GameFonts
extends java.lang.Object
    Class containing all the types and styles of messages or labels displayed to the user

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DIFFICULTY 
      static int ERROR 
      static int FACT 
      static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.awt.Font> fontsMap
      Map that connect a number with a certain pre-determined font style
      static java.lang.String IMPACT_PATH
      Configuration Constant - path to the file "impact.ttf", which is needed in order to import font with "impact" style
      in Linux Systems.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameFonts()
      Constructor.
      Fills the fontsMap with all the application veriaty of font styles

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private java.awt.Font createImpactFont()
      Special function for creating fonts with style "impact", since it's used alot in various sizes in the application.
      The function reads from the file located in the IMPACT_PATH and retreave a new font
      static java.awt.Font getFont(int font)
      Called by all GUI components that requires a certain font style.

      • IMPACT_PATH

        public static java.lang.String IMPACT_PATH
        Configuration Constant - path to the file "impact.ttf", which is needed in order to import font with "impact" style
        in Linux Systems.

        public GameFonts()

    • Method Detail

      • createImpactFont

        private java.awt.Font createImpactFont()
        Special function for creating fonts with style "impact", since it's used alot in various sizes in the application.
        The function reads from the file located in the IMPACT_PATH and retreave a new font
        Returns:
        font of style impact

      • getFont

        public static java.awt.Font getFont(int font)
        Called by all GUI components that requires a certain font style.
        Parameters:
        font - number of font, associated with a certain font style
        Returns:
        the font style associated with the font number parameter
